website_summaries.verdict: A high efficiency natural gas tankless water heater that is designated for indoor installation.
pros: This Energy Star-qualified model is approved for use in altitudes of up to 10,200 feet
Instead of a pilot light, this model features an electronic ignition to help save you money in fuel costs
cons: Installation of this model can be tricky
If you do not have plumbing experience, it is best to hire a professional

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Tankless unit
customer_reviews.text: I have installed 4 different brands of tankless heaters for different properties over last several years. This is by far the best built and most reliable over time. If you want a dependable unit that produces constant hot water for 3-4 person household this will meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna K. Handy

customer_reviews.title: No problems here
customer_reviews.text: Works great, quiet, gas bill is $20 a month...and I have 4 women and 3 showers in my house
customer_reviews.author: David Hines

customer_reviews.title: Had it installed by a plumber, so can't comment ...
customer_reviews.text: Had it installed by a plumber, so can't comment on the ease of installation, but working well so far. We have have a family of 4 with 2 small kids. So between baths and showers everyday, tons of dishes, and holy smokes the laundry!!!, we have never had an issue with not enough hot water flow. My only knock, is that it's a little slow to heat up. Turn the kitchen faucet on full, and it takes 30-60 seconds before the water gets hot. This is our first tankless system, so don't know how normal this is.
customer_reviews.author: Moe E.

customer_reviews.title: question before rating
customer_reviews.text: Wandering why its advertised at 6.6 gpm but the energy label that comes with the unit says maximum gallons per minute is 3.3. What am i not getting.
customer_reviews.author: Steve V.

customer_reviews.title: Best Heater Ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this upgrade. We went from a 14 year old Bosch that was improperly installed with no flush valves to this. It was easy to install, we had our plumber do it as he installed the same one in his home. We have 2 full baths and have no interruptions while in use. Don't forget the condensing tube, the clear tube you see in my pic. You NEED that tube.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Rose

customer_reviews.title: I like that this have moved into the smart home space
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for a failing 40 gallon. I like that this have moved into the smart home space. I like that I can change the temparature delivered on demand. I can add remotes by the sink and get hotter water for dishes or in the bathroom and get a perfect shower. The smaller foot print has lef me room for a water softner in the same space the water heater filled up before. If you want to go tankless do your homework about water temperature in your area, size of the gas feed line required, number of outlets you are providing hot water too at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great water heater! Use all Rinnai products when installing. Only the Rinnai vent system will work.
customer_reviews.author: Hansen's Collision

customer_reviews.title: MAKE SURE YOU TEST ALL RINNAI UNITS IMMEDIATELY UPON RECEIPT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this water heater ( inside, propane, 6.5 gallon/minute ) in December 2019 when I started renovating my house. I finally have electric, water and propane (March 2020). I installed the water heater in March 2020 and I get error 65 (internal device error). I never used the device, but because I waited 90 days to install it, I am not able to return the unit. It cost me over $600 and it is not usable. I am so very frustrated and mad.
customer_reviews.author: suz13413

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have a good ventilation on top. This can cause some error on the unit if inadequate venting
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a big water tank with this unit and since I did that, I am very pleased with the results. No more running out of hot water ! We have a big tub in the bathroom, and could not fill it before with the water tank. No issue now. I installed it myself and it took only a few hours to mount it. And since we replaced the water tank, there is a lot of space gained in the garage.

customer_reviews.title: Caution: in accurate estimated yearly energy cost

For those of you using the estimated yearly energy cost to help you choose, the picture posted by the manufacturer doesn’t accurately represent what’s actually in the box. Since I have no choice but to install this today, I’ll come back and update my post after I’ve installed it and used it.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for a tank water heater

I wish it would go to 130, I had to adjust the shower water mixer to allow more hot at the hot setting, but it works well. Easy on the propane, too. Can't speak to how it works for higher water load demands.

customer_reviews.text: What they don't tell you is that you will spend the same amount of money (or more) on piping and fittings to properly install this water heater. customer_reviews.title: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Love this tankless water heater.

I like a very hot shower sometimes. Otherwise it does provide tons of hot water, without too long of a wait. I think it takes about 2 minutes for the hot water to get to the farthest shower in my house. Once it is hot, I haven't been able to make it run out of hot water, yet. Love the streamlined unit, in my garage, too. It looks fantastic!

customer_reviews.title: Great tankless water heater
customer_reviews.text: My big tanks water heater was leaking, so it was time for a replacement. I have always wanted a tankless water heater for my home but they are always so expensive. So I decided to look online and found this one with great reviews. I just had to pay someone to install it. It came out to be less than half the prices I was being quoted for tankless water heater and install. Works great, very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Replacing old unit.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced this with an older model of Rinnai. These units work great. I was disappointed that the dimensions were slightly different and would not mount back in the same place. The vent pipe was a 1/4" different and I had to order a new one. It would be nice if the web page would explain that these changes have been made so the consumer would be informed/

customer_reviews.title: Great water heater

I did have to run an outlet( which seems scary, but really not hard at all). I did have to sweat some pipes ( again, seems scary, but not at all). I also needed some assitance mounting it on the wall. Past that, i had very few issues installing it myself.
customer_reviews.author: joshua murray

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully

This was a self install and with exception of new pipe due to new construction, the install was not extremely difficult. Operation is wonderful and the hot water continues without fear of running out. Highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but not for a big bathtub
customer_reviews.text: The product works very well. However, for my circumstances I purchased the wrong unit. We have a very large soaking tub with high outflow into the tub. This water heater does not produce enough hot water to match the outflow. Consequently the hot water shuts off and it’s a challenge to fill the tub with hot water unless I reduce the flow into the tub substantially. It works great for the sinks and shower, but if you have a big tub, I would recommend a water heater with a flow of at least 10 gallons per minute.

customer_reviews.title: Crappy piece of equipment & total imposters

customer_reviews.title: The temperature will go above 120!
customer_reviews.text: For those that are complaining about the temperature of 120. There is a switch inside the unit that has to be flipped to allow the water temperature to be increased above 120. I run mine at 130 and found the you tube video on which switch to flip. It should also say in the owners manual or side of unit also.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent never-ending source of hot water

Our church also uses bigger Rinnai units to provide hot water for baptisms and they've worked for years. A reliable, constant supply of hot water - just what we want!

customer_reviews.title: A really great water heater

customer_reviews.title: Takes a minute for water to get hot

The upside is that you're not using electricity to keep the water in the tank hot when you're not using it, so good for a solar setup. Had it in 6 months with no problems.

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly and at low flow!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Rinnai I've put in. Replaced a different on demand heater in my own house that always took too long to initiate. This one kicks on immediately and you don't have to run the water full bore to get it to come one. Only downside is that after 120 degrees you can only go up by 5 degree increments. We keep our water at 130 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Natan der Weisse

customer_reviews.title: Only capable of ONE shower at a time!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Only capable of one shower at a time! I turned on shower, sink, and kitchen sink, and water pressure was non existent for all three. It was great when only the one shower was in use, so if you are single, and can wait to do laundry and dishes until after you take a shower, then this product should be perfect for you. If there’s a chance that you will be running more than one shower at a time, this heater is simply a waste of money.
